newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares close up, seen heading for new high.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares close up, seen heading for new high.

text.p: Danish share prices closed higher on Tuesday and dealers said that the rising New York market was likely to nudge Copenhagen to a new record high on Wednesday.
"There is a basis for rises to a new record when you look at how the Dow Jones has risen," a dealer said.
Copenhagen's KFX top-20 index closed 0.36 point up, at 144.43, in overall bourse turnover of 948 million crowns.
The current closing record is 145.52, set on January 16.
The KFX March future rose 1.50 point to 145.50, with 210 contracts, each worth 100,000 crowns, traded.
